details.description: You must be get a licence from the Department for Environment, Food and Rural Affairs (Defra) to move cattle, deer, goats, pigs or sheep in England.
details.will_continue_on: the Department for Environment, Food and Rural Affairs (Defra) website
details.licence_short_description: Get a licence to move cattle, deer, goats, pigs or sheep from the Department for Environment, Food and Rural Affairs (Defra) in England.
details.licence_overview:
You must not move cattle, deer, goats, pigs or sheep from any premises unless the movement is made under the authority of a General Movement Licence for each species from the Department for Environment, Food and Rural Affairs (Defra). All movements must also comply with the conditions of the licence.

In addition, all movements of deer, sheep and goats must be accompanied by a completed Animal Movement Licence (AML) obtained from your local authority. Pigs must be accompanied by the AML movement document (until 31/03/11) or a haulier summary introduced with the electronic pig reporting system called eAML2 (operated by the British Pig Executive) from  01/10/11.

Cattle must be accompanied by their passports and all cattle movements must be notified to the British Cattle Movement Service within three days of the movement taking place.

Any animal movement will also trigger a 6 day standstill (or 20 days for pigs) on the premises of destination where other movements are prohibited unless an exception applies.

*[AML]: Animal Movement Licence 
*[Defra]: Department for Environment, Food and Rural Affairs
